prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Godot described her as 'clad in her stunning Japanese garb surrounded by the hue and aroma of Western tastes'.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the Inner Temple that night and I saw it all happen in the garden.
Person: Iris
Testimony 1
Testimony: I saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff!
Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: While Mystic Maya was still stumbling, Mystic Elise moved in to deliver a fatal strike!
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Mystic Maya tried desperately to defend herself and stole the weapon...!
Person: Iris
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was only in self-defense! You can't blame her for it!
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
The contradictions appear between Iris's testimony (Testimony 0-5) and Iris's alibi (Evidence 12: Iris's Testimony). Iris claims she was at the Inner Temple garden and saw the whole incident happen (Testimony 0), but in Evidence 12, Iris states she rang the lights out bell at 10 PM and then was in her room until the murder was discovered, implying she could not have witnessed the murder in the garden.

Thus, the contradiction is between Evidence 12 and Testimony 0 (and related testimonies from Iris). Since only one pair is allowed, the clearest contradiction is between Evidence 12 ("Iris's Testimony" stating she was in her room from 10 PM) and Testimony 0 (Iris "saw it all happen in the garden").

cot: The "Dagger" (Evidence 19) was found stuck in a pine tree in the Inner Temple garden and the blood on it does not match the victim's blood. However, in Iris's Testimony (Testimonies 0 to 4), it is stated that "Mystic Maya stabbed Mystic Elise," implying that the dagger used in the murder was used by Maya to stab Elise. If Maya stabbed Elise, the dagger should have the victim's blood and should be the murder weapon. Therefore, Evidence 19 and the combined testimonies of Iris (Testimonies 0 to 4) directly contradict each other.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0

Person: Iris
Testimony 1

Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: So I removed the body from the Inner Temple by myself...
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: I dragged it behind me all the way across Dusky Bridge.
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Then I used the snowmobile to carry it back to Hazakura Temple and...
Person: Iris

Person: Iris
Testimony 6
Testimony: By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped.
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 7 (Weather Data) states that snow fell from 7 PM to approximately 10:50 PM, and lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM. It also notes that about 30 minutes passed between the fire starting and going out, and Bikini claims she saw the murder at around 11 PM.

Testimony 6 by Iris says, "By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped." Since the snow stopped at approximately 10:50 PM according to the weather data, and the murder was seen at 11 PM, these two statements seem consistent regarding the snow stopping before the murder occurred.

However, Iris's testimony 4 and 5 describe actions involving moving the body and then using the Shichishito to alter the wound, implying some timing considerations.

More importantly, looking at Iris's Testimonies 2, 3, 4, and 5 collectively suggests she moved the body "across Dusky Bridge" and "used the Shichishito," but the evidence shows:

Evidence 10 (Shichishito) is stated to have the victim's blood and suspect's fingerprints but is explicitly not the murder weapon.

Because the Shichishito is linked to altering the wound but has evidence of victim's blood, it's contradictory that it was not the murder weapon, yet used to alter the wound.

Also, Iris claims she removed the body herself and dragged it across the Dusky Bridge (Testimonies 2 and 3), but from Evidence 7 and 14 (Tracks Photo) and the timeline of the murder, the movement of the body might conflict with the time of the murder and snow conditions.

Looking specifically for a direct contradiction, the clearest is:

Evidence 7 says snow stopped approximately 10:50 PM, but Bikini says she saw the murder at 11 PM (timing consistency), and Iris says the murder happened after snow stopped.

However, Iris's Testimony 6 states "By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped." which aligns.

Looking for contradiction:

Iris’s Testimony 6 says snow stopped before the murder, but Evidence 7 shows snow continuing until 10:50 PM, with lightning at 10:45 PM. If the fire started around 10:45 PM, and lasted 30 minutes, this would go beyond the snow stopping time.

Bikini's statement that she saw the murder at around 11 PM conflicts with Iris's statements about the timeline.

But these are consistent.

Upon review, the strongest direct contradiction is the Testimonies vs. Evidence about the Shichishito:

Evidence 10: Shichishito - Had victim's blood and suspect's fingerprints, but is NOT the murder weapon.

Iris Testimony 5 says: "...I used the Shichishito to alter the way the wound looked."

If the Shichishito altered the wound, but is not the murder weapon, this suggests the real murder weapon is different.

Evidence 9 (Victim's Staff) is the actual murder weapon but is hidden.

Therefore, Iris's statement about using the Shichishito to alter the wound is contradicted by evidence that it was not the weapon.

Hence, the contradiction is:

Evidence 10 vs. Iris's Testimony 5.

cot: The contradiction lies between Evidence 20 (Stone Lantern) and Testimony 4 (Maya's statement). Evidence 20 states that the stone lantern was not lit the night of the crime, whereas Maya testifies that she could see a man behind her attacker by the light of the stone lantern. If the lantern was not lit, it would be unlikely for Maya to see anyone by its light.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: ...When I came to, I was just lying there on the Training Hall floor.
Person: Maya
Testimony 1
Testimony: By the time I got back to the garden, the place had totally changed...
Person: Maya
Testimony 2
Testimony: I think it was for my sake that the killer cleaned up the evidence of what had happened.
Person: Maya
Testimony 3
Testimony: The torches were lit... And the body was gone.
Person: Maya
Testimony 4
Testimony: And all of the snow around the stone lantern had been carefully cleaned up, too.
Person: Maya
Testimony 5
Testimony: Since the person did all that work alone, I just assumed it was a man...
Person: Maya

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 20 (Stone Lantern) states that the lantern was not lit the night of the crime. However, Testimony 3 from Maya mentions, "The torches were lit... And the body was gone." Torches and lanterns are different types of light sources, so this isn't a direct contradiction. Instead, look for contradictions related to lighting or the state of the scene.

Evidence 20 says the stone lantern was not lit, and Testimony 4 says, "And all of the snow around the stone lantern had been carefully cleaned up, too." Cleaning snow around the lantern implies that the area was accessed, but there's no direct contradiction there since the lantern wasn't lit but the snow was cleared.

Testimony 5 says, "Since the person did all that work alone, I just assumed it was a man..." This is an assumption rather than a fact to compare with evidence.

Testimony 1 says, "By the time I got back to the garden, the place had totally changed..." This is a general statement that does not conflict with any specific evidence.

Testimony 2: "I think it was for my sake that the killer cleaned up the evidence of what had happened." This aligns with the evidence of cleaned-up snow.

Testimony 0: "...When I came to, I was just lying there on the Training Hall floor." No contradiction with evidence.

Testimony 3: "The torches were lit... And the body was gone." versus Evidence 20: "Stone Lantern was not lit." Since these are different light sources (torches vs. lantern), this is not necessarily a contradiction.

Let's look at Evidence 9 (Victim's Staff): Carried by Elise, has her fingerprints, hidden sword, and is actual murder weapon; only Gumshoe and the player know this.

Evidence 10 (Shichishito): The apparent murder weapon, has victim's blood and suspect's fingerprints, but is NOT the murder weapon.

No direct contradictions to testimonies here.

Evidence 6 (Iris's Hood): Protected her from evil spirits; Testimony 12 (Iris's Testimony) states she rang the lights-out bell at 10 PM and was in her room until the murder was discovered. No contradictions.

Looking closer, Testimony 3 says "The torches were lit..." but Evidence 20 states the "Stone Lantern was not lit the night of the crime." If the torches were lit, then the stone lantern not being lit is still consistent. So no contradiction here.

Also, Maya states in Testimony 4: "And all the snow around the stone lantern had been carefully cleaned," implying someone cleaned the snow around the stone lantern.

However, Evidence 7 (Weather Data) says it was snowing heavily until approx. 10:50 PM. Lightning at 10:45 on the Dusky Bridge. If the snow was still falling around the time of the murder, the snow should have been accumulating. But the snow around the stone lantern was cleaned up.

Maya's Testimony 5 says: "Since the person did all that work alone, I just assumed it was a man," but this is just her assumption, no evidence to contradict.

One strong contradiction: Testimony 3 says "torches were lit," but Evidence 20 says the stone lantern was not lit. While these are different light sources, typically both would be lit to illuminate the garden. So if the torches were lit but the stone lantern not lit, that might indicate contradictory conditions about the lighting.

But to find a clearer contradiction:

Testimony 4 says, "And all the snow around the stone lantern had been carefully cleaned up, too." However, the Stone Lantern (Evidence 20) was not lit that night.

Cleaning snow around the lantern suggests someone was present and active near the lantern, perhaps carrying out acts such as lighting it or using it.

Therefore, the contradiction is that the stone lantern was not lit (evidence), yet the snow around it was carefully cleaned (testimony). If the lantern was not lit, there would be no reason to clear snow around it.

Hence, the pair is Evidence 20 and Testimony 4.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 0 says: "Pearly was also stuck on the Inner Temple side that night!" (Person: Maya), meaning Pearl Fey could not have crossed the Dusky Bridge.

Evidence 14 is "Tracks Photo: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge." If this photo shows tracks going across the Dusky Bridge, and if Pearl's tracks are included, then it contradicts the testimony that Pearl was stuck on one side.

Alternatively, Evidence 21 "Dusky Bridge Photo: Taken the morning after the crime." shows the bridge, but not necessary contradiction.

No direct contradiction there.

Another pair to consider:

Testimony 12 Iris's Testimony: "Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered." So Iris was in her room at the time of the murder.

Evidence 6 Iris's Hood: "Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits."

If Iris only got the hood before the lights-out bell at 10 PM, and the murder was between 10-11 PM (Evidence 11: Autopsy report), and Iris was in her room, then her being in her room is consistent.

No contradiction.

Another possibility:

Evidence 9: Victim's Staff: "Has a sword hidden inside. Has the actual weapon used to murder the victim."

Evidence 10: Shichishito: "The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon."

So evidence 10 says it's "had victim's blood and suspect's fingerprints," but is not the murder weapon, whereas evidence 9 says the victim's staff had a sword hidden inside which was the actual weapon.

No contradiction, actually clarifies.

Looking again:

Testimony 3: "That's when Mr. Godot arrived at the Inner Temple for the first time!" (Maya)

Testimony 4: "He found Pearly first, and cheered her right up!" (Maya)

If Godot arrived after 10:45 PM (when lightning struck Dusky Bridge, Evidence 7) and the murder happened between 10-11 PM (Evidence 11), then Godot found Pearly first.

But if Testimony 0 says Pearly was stuck on Inner Temple side, and Godot arrived at Inner Temple, the timeline seems consistent.

Looking at possibilities between Evidence 7 and Testimony 12:

Evidence 7: Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM; snow from 7-10:50 PM; murder time 10-11 PM (Evidence 11).

Iris testified ringing lights out bell at 10 PM; was then in her room until the murder was discovered.

If lights out bell rang at 10 PM, but the lightning struck at 10:45 PM, and murder time is between 10-11 PM, and Iris was alone in her room during that time, where was the murder committed?

If Iris was in her room, she cannot be the killer.

No direct contradiction there.

Another pair:

Testimony 1: "The next morning, she looked around, but couldn't find anyone." (Maya)

Testimony 2: "The next day, when the bridge was finally fixed, she was in the spare prep room." (Maya)

If the bridge was not fixed until the next day, but Maya was in the spare prep room, how did she get there? Unless she was already on the same side.

No clear contradiction.

One more possibility is the photograph evidence vs testimony about Pearl.

Given from Testimony 0 Pearl was stuck on the Inner Temple side.

Evidence 14 is "Tracks photo: From main gate to Dusky Bridge" (possibly showing footprints crossing the bridge.)

If tracks include footprints going across, and one is thought to be Pearl's, then the testimony and evidence contradict.

Hence, the best answer is:

Evidence 14 (Tracks Photo) suggests footprints crossing the Dusky Bridge.

Testimony 0 says Pearl was stuck on the Inner Temple side and could not cross.

This contradicts each other.
